title: World Tidal Phenomena
description: Tides, tidal bores, and coastal phenomena

questions.question: The Bay of Fundy, which has the highest tides in the world, is located between which two Canadian provinces?
What primarily causes ocean tides?
options: Gravitational pull of the Moon and Sun

questions.question: What is a tidal bore?
options: A gap between two tidal pools
A wave that travels up a river against the current during incoming tide

questions.question: The Qiantang River in China is famous for having one of the world's largest tidal bores. What is it called?
Mont Saint-Michel in France becomes an island during high tide. What is it famous for being?
What are 'spring tides'?
options: Exceptionally high and low tides during new and full moons
Tides that only occur in springtime

questions.question: The Severn Bore is a famous tidal bore in which country?
What term describes the smallest tidal range, occurring when the Sun and Moon are at right angles to Earth?
The Maelstrom, a powerful tidal whirlpool, is found off the coast of which country?
The 'Jindo Sea Parting' in South Korea, where the sea parts to reveal a land bridge, is caused by what?
How many high tides does most of the world's coastline experience in a 24-hour period?
King tides are the highest tides of the year. When do they typically occur?
options: When the Moon is closest to Earth

questions.question: The Old Man of Hoy, a famous sea stack shaped by tidal erosion, is found in which island group?
Tidal power, which harnesses the energy of tides to generate electricity, has a major plant on the Rance River in which country?
The Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland, with its hexagonal basalt columns exposed at low tide, was formed by what natural process?
